snippet: The decision to once again prosecute Sergei L. Magnitsky, whose death in prison was considered a symbol of rights abuses in Russia, infuriated his family and former employer.
abstract: Russian police plan to resubmit for trial a tax evasion case involving Sergei L Magnitsky, who died in custody in 2009; case would be the first posthumous prosecution in Russian legal history, and critics say it is motivated by a desire to vindicate officials Magnitsky had accused of corruption before he died; death drew international criticism over Russia's human rights record.
lead_paragraph: The decision to once again prosecute Sergei L. Magnitsky, whose death in prison was considered a symbol of rights abuses in Russia, infuriated his family and former employer.

headline.seo: Russia Plans to Retry Dead Lawyer Sergei L. Magnitsky in Tax Case
headline.main: Russia Plans to Retry Dead Lawyer in Tax Case
headline.print_headline: Russia Plans To Prosecute Dead Lawyer In Tax Case

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
